intro: Aglaia ovata, commonly known as the white aglaia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Magnoliaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Aglaia ovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
